content: quote: Originally posted by heckilldoit: As a Marine in this unit at this time I have no problem with what we are doing. I have been in Arty for 9 years and come to expect mission changes and non standard missions. It's a known fact that even if Artillery support is not needed that support from an Artillery unit will be. With our heavy lift capabilities, variety of MOS's, and the flexibility of Marine NCO's and SNCO's in general; you can expect that Artillery will be used even in a fight where you cannot just launch 100lb rounds into a city without hurting more than you will help. I am proud to do what I am doing here and proud to be serving my country however I am doing it. Semper Fidelis! That was me, I posted that. I can't believe how well thought out that was. I miss the sound of those guns. Can someone move this to the Marine Artillery forum?
quote: Originally posted by heckilldoit: As a Marine in this unit at this time I have no problem with what we are doing. With our heavy lift capabilities, variety of MOS's, and the flexibility of Marine NCO's and SNCO's in general; you can expect that Artillery will be used even in a fight where you cannot just launch 100lb rounds into a city without hurting more than you will help. I am proud to do what I am doing here and proud to be serving my country however I am doing it. Semper Fidelis!
reply: That was me, I posted that. I can't believe how well thought out that was. I miss the sound of those guns. Can someone move this to the Marine Artillery forum?
title: Role of Artillery Changing in Iraq
